data.title: 20 Celebrities That Live in Naples, Florida
data.meta_description: Some of the richest and most famous people in America live in Naples. Which ones call it their home? Find the celebrities that live in Naples Florida here.
data.text:
Naples Florida and Marco Island are gorgeous parts of the Paradise Coast here in Florida. It’s a place that many people love to call home and are proud to live in.

It’s also quite a glamorous place to live. There are stunning shops and gorgeous coastlines to enjoy, making it a truly special part of Florida.

Don’t believe us? Here are twenty celebrities that live in Naples Florida. Let’s take a look at who loves Naples Florida as much as we do!

Famous Musicians in Naples Florida

There are a few different musicians who have made Naples Florida their home. And, no wonder! This is an inspiring place to call home, and would certainly give us plenty of ideas for song lyrics.

If you want to see any of these beautiful homes in Naples, you can take a mansion sunset cruise. You’ll be escorted around the beautiful homes in the area and can gush over the opulence of the houses.

Alex Lifeson

Alex Lifeson is the lead guitarist for the progressive rock band known as Rush. Born in Canada, Alex Lifeson rose to fame with his band. While he focuses on guitar, he also plays mandolin, bass, keyboard, and synth among other instruments. Today, he lives in a condo in Pelican Bay.

Bob Seger

Another rocker who calls Naples home is Bob Seger. He was a popular artist during the hippie craze of the 1960s and released his first album in 1968. Today, he lives a quiet life in his Naples condo.

Donna Summer

For fans of retro disco, they’ll be thrilled to know that Donna Summer once called Naples home. Donna Summer rose to fame as the Queen of Disco with her 42 hits during the 1970s. Before she passed away in 2012, she called Tiburon, Naples her home.

All-Star Athletes That Call Naples Home

It’s not just the creative right-brained celebrities that live in Florida. Naples is also home to several sports legends. After successful athletic careers, many all-star athletes have chosen to call Naples home.

Fuzzy Zoeller

Die-hard golf fans will go wild to know that one of the PGA Tour champions, Fuzzy Zoeller, has enjoyed living part-time in Naples since the 1970s. Now retired, Zoeller was a two-time winner of the PGA Tour, making him someone golf fans will love to catch a glimpse of.

John Kruk

John Kruk, a former Philadelphia Phillies player, retired to Naples Florida after his successful MLB player. He didn’t leave his Philadelphia roots behind, however. Today, he owns a restaurant in North Naples that serves up Philly Cheesesteaks like the ones he enjoyed back home.

Rocco Mediate

Fuzzy Zoeller isn’t the only golfer who lives in Naples. You’ll also find Rocco Mediate, a six-time winner of the PGA Tour and three-time winner of the Champions Tour. After his successful golf career, Rocco chose to retire to the gorgeous Tuscany Reserve right here in Naples.

Larry Bird

Do you love basketball? Then you’ll be excited to know that Larry Bird, a famous NBA player, has lived in a gorgeous waterfront house here in Naples for years. He recently listed it for sale, however, so if you want a chance at spotting this legend you’ll have to book a dinner cruise past his mansion before he leaves town!

Charlie Babb

A Florida native, Charlie Babb used to play as a safety with the Miami Dolphins back in 1972’s perfect season. After a successful seven-year career, he chose to retire to Naples Florida. Today, he still owns a home in the area.

Earl Morrall

Another Miami Dolphins player followed suit and moved to Naples, too. Earl Morrall was one of Charlie Babb’s teammates back in the perfect season of 1972. He spent many happy years in his Naples home before passing away in 2014.

Gene Sarazen

One of the longest celebrity golfer residences in Marco Island was that of Gene Sarazen. Gene, another PGA Tour golfer spent 34 happy years calling the area his home. He passed away in 1999, leaving us with his golf legacy and his gorgeous Naples mansion to boast about.

Book Authors That Live in Naples Florida

Do you love curling up with a good book? While reading might not be one of the most popular things to do in Naples, the authors of many books have chosen to call this area their home. Here are a few famous writers who have fallen in love with the area’s gorgeous blue waters and sunny skies.

Robin Cook

Robin Cook is the author of several books about medicine. He mostly writes nonfiction books that detail public health issues and draw on his experience as a physician to offer insight and solutions to these problems. Robin Cook spends half his time in New Hampshire and lives part-time in Naples.

Janet Evanovich

Do you love the Stephanie Plum books? The author of this thrilling mystery adventure series, Janet Evanovich, lives right here in Naples for part of the year. Bring your copy of One for the Money on a Naples Boat Tour and drift past her gorgeous mansion in the area!

Ben Bova

Prestigious science fiction author, Ben Bova, has lived in Naples for years. This celebrity author has won the Hugo Award six times and has served as president and advisor for several space organizations. He has written several science fiction books that are well worth reading.

Robert Ludlum

Another famous writer who chose to call Naples his home is Robert Ludlum. Robert Ludlum is the author of the famous Jason Bourne series, among many other thriller books. Until passing away in 2001, Robert Ludlum lived in a high-rise in Naples’ Park Shore area.

Actors and Radio Stars Living in Naples Florida

Actors and radio stars have also chosen to make the beautiful neighborhoods of Naples Florida their home. Many of them live here year-round, meaning you might be lucky enough to spot one of them while out and about on the town! Here are a couple of famous media stars that you might catch a glimpse of while in Naples.

Judge Judy Sheindlin

Who doesn’t love sitting down to an episode (or five) of Judge Judy? The famous judge in the show, Judge Judy Sheindlin, actually lives right here in Pelican Bay! She often does her shopping at the Waterside Shops, which means you may get a chance to greet this incredible television personality.

Sean Hannity

Have you ever heard of The Sean Hannity Show? This political talk show is run by American host Sean Hannity, who also runs a FOX News Channel show. Sean Hannity doesn’t spend all his time on the radio, however. When he’s not working he enjoys hanging out in his Moraya Bay Beach Tower penthouse here in Naples.

Brett Baier

Another talk show host you’ll find in Naples Florida is Brett Baier. Baier runs the Special Report with Brett Baier, which is featured on FOX News. Currently, it’s one of the top programs in cable news. Not only does he own a vacation home in Naples, but his in-laws and his parents also call the area home.

Jane Seymour

Jane Seymore is the star of many amazing films and television shows and lives here in Naples Florida. You may know her from Live and Let Die or from her starring role in Doctor Quinn Medicine Woman. No matter what it is you recognize her by, you’ll probably see her wandering around town or working on a set here in Naples at some point or another.

Mary Carillo

Mary Carillo is a television star who’s had many different roles. For one, she’s well-known as a TV personality. In addition, she was a previous professional tennis player and today serves as a sports journalist. She lives part-time in New York City and spends the rest of her time in Naples Florida.

Neal Boortz

Neal Boortz is a retired host of a radio talk show that is known nationally. He owns not one but two homes here in Naples. You might spot him and his wife Donna at their Marco Island condo or perhaps you’ll see them leaving their penthouse in the heart of the city.

Businesspeople You’ll Find in Naples Florida

It’s not all fun and games in Naples Florida, although we’d certainly like to think so! Sometimes, you have to get down to business, and that’s exactly what these business celebrities did when they decided to call Naples Florida home.

John Schnatter

Who doesn’t love a slice of pizza pie? John Schnatter is the founder of Papa John’s pizza. He’s still chairman of the board today. When he’s not busy cooking up your favorite cheesy meal, he’s often relaxing at his vacation home in the heart of Naples Florida.

Shahid Khan

Shahid Khan is listed on Forbes 400 list of the richest people in America. He’s the owner of the Jacksonville Jaguars team, two soccer leagues, and the company Flex-N-Gate. He also happens to call Naples his home and resides right here in Southwest Florida.

Richard Schulze

If you enjoy buying your electronics from Best Buy, you might recognize the name, Richard Schulze. Schulze is the current chairman and original founder of this electronics superstore. He used to live in Bonita Springs, which is near Naples. Today, he lives in the beautiful Port Royal community here in Naples.

Tom Golisano

Anyone who gets paid by Paychex should recognize the name, Tom Golisano. This man is the chairman and founder of that famous payroll firm. He spends a lot of his money donating to Naples charities, such as the Golisano Children’s Hospital of Southwest Florida and the Golisano Children’s Museum of Naples. When he’s not giving to charity, he relaxes in his Naples home.

Politicians Who Call Naples Florida Their Home

Our list of Naples celebrities simply wouldn’t be complete without throwing in a few politicians. Here are a few key players in the world of politics who have taken up residence in Naples and Marco Island Florida.

Rick Scott

Rick Scott is one of Florida’s former governors. He’s mostly known, however, because he is currently serving as a U.S Senator. Scott cares about furthering the mission of the Republican Party and continues to work hard in government today. He owns a gorgeous mansion in Naples that’s located right on the beach.

Charles Colson

Have you heard of the Watergate Scandal from the time of Richard Nixon’s presidency? If so, you may know about Charles Colson. This politician was a felon in the Watergate Scandal. After his disastrous political career, he chose to retire to Naples Florida, and call this area his home. Sadly, he passed away in 2012.

Make This Area Your Home Like These Celebrities That Live in Naples Florida

Naples Florida is an amazing place to live. That’s why these twenty celebrities that live in Naples Florida have decided to call this area their own. They know that Naples Florida offers amazing shops, scenery, and activities.

One of the best activities in the area that you can check out is a boat tour. On top of that, a boat tour will give you an opportunity to sail around the beautiful Pelican Bay and check out some of the stunning mansions owned by these celebrities.
